product.description: PLAY IN STYLE. Top the leaderboard in style on the new Dell G16 Gaming Laptop. Enjoy all the benefits of a portable gaming laptop with a larger 16:10 aspect ratio. The 2560x1600 QHD+ resolution and 16-inch display makes your favorite games look next level - with uninterrupted gameplay and vivid visuals that let you fully immerse in the game.

feature_bullets: Memory Performance: Boost your gaming performance with 16GB of LPDDR5x integrated memory. Enjoy faster load times, smoother gameplay, and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
Remarkably Fast Refresh Rates Fast reaction times on the 240Hz VRR displays lets you play without a lag.
13th Generation Intel Processors: Combined with the latest powerful NVIDIA GeForce RTX Graphics to support the most graphic-intensive games.
Fast DDR5 Memory: Play locally and lag-free with 16GB of DDR5 memory and up to 1TB of internal storage.

Alienware-Inspired Thermal Design: Four heat pipes and two fans with ultra-thin blades paired with a Vapor Chamber combine to stabilize the laptop’s performance even during the most chaotic in-game segments.
Gaming-Inspired Colors: Metallic Nightshade with Black thermal shelf

top_reviews.title: A solid reliable laptop
top_reviews.body: I have owned many Dell computers in my lifetime and this one is a solid performer for gaming and everyday usage. Its only weakness is that the audio port seems to be a dust magnet and has to be blown out regularly to maintain a connection to an external speaker or headphone. I got tired of blasting it with a can of compressed air so I just use Bluetooth for external sound with it now. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
I have owned many Dell computers in my lifetime and this one is a solid performer for gaming and everyday usage. Its only weakness is that the audio port seems to be a dust magnet and has to be blown out regularly to maintain a connection to an external speaker or headphone. I got tired of blasting it with a can of compressed air so I just use Bluetooth for external sound with it now.
Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2024

top_reviews.title: Endless problems
top_reviews.body: Have had numerous serious issues with this laptop since I bought it. Every windows update breaks something else in the software.  The Alienware command center app is a RAM hog. Playing WoW with discord open and the Alienware system monitor overlay was using 15 GB of RAM. The "Gaming mode" button that turns on turbo performance is also reportedly responsible for frying people's CPUs. I think mine is a victim of that as well.  The PC overheats without the turbo mode on because the fans hardly work in normal performance mode. Mine likes to shut off randomly without warning or errors. I first thought it was overheating but it does it sometimes within minutes of being turned on for the first time in a day.  Today, it shut off twice so I pulled the cover to check the battery connection. After unplugging the battery and plugging it back in, the PC would not turn on for about 30 minutes at all. It also now will not turn on unless it's plugged in, regardless of the battery charge, which remains at 81% and healthy according to the BIOS.  Every update of windows or audio drivers changes the settings and defaults of my headphones to something else. There's are 3 locations of settings to choose which audio hardware you are using, and they all get swapped around. Having to dig through each one to figure out why my mic stops working for example, is annoying.  These issues are far beyond my ability and desire to fix. In short, this has been the most problematic PC I've ever had the displeasure of using. And at $1700 it's laughably bad. A "Gaming PC" that overheats at idle while the screen is in sleep mode is just stupid. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Have had numerous serious issues with this laptop since I bought it. Every windows update breaks something else in the software.

The Alienware command center app is a RAM hog. Playing WoW with discord open and the Alienware system monitor overlay was using 15 GB of RAM. The "Gaming mode" button that turns on turbo performance is also reportedly responsible for frying people's CPUs. I think mine is a victim of that as well.

The PC overheats without the turbo mode on because the fans hardly work in normal performance mode. Mine likes to shut off randomly without warning or errors. I first thought it was overheating but it does it sometimes within minutes of being turned on for the first time in a day.

Today, it shut off twice so I pulled the cover to check the battery connection. After unplugging the battery and plugging it back in, the PC would not turn on for about 30 minutes at all. It also now will not turn on unless it's plugged in, regardless of the battery charge, which remains at 81% and healthy according to the BIOS.

Every update of windows or audio drivers changes the settings and defaults of my headphones to something else. There's are 3 locations of settings to choose which audio hardware you are using, and they all get swapped around. Having to dig through each one to figure out why my mic stops working for example, is annoying.

These issues are far beyond my ability and desire to fix. In short, this has been the most problematic PC I've ever had the displeasure of using. And at $1700 it's laughably bad. A "Gaming PC" that overheats at idle while the screen is in sleep mode is just stupid.
Read more

top_reviews.title: Works good but not too impressed with performance when it comes to gaming
top_reviews.body: My first gaming laptop ever so far I like it my only issue is it's nowhere near as powerful as my desktop which understandably cuz desktops have more expandability but with the same memory better processor than my gaming PC and a newer gaming video card than my desktop PC which has a RTX 3070 TI gave me laptop has RTX 4070 but still does not outperform the desktop PC so still deciding if I should keep it or returning it and it said just use my Xbox series s downstairs or when I travel Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2025

top_reviews.title: Es lo que esperaba
top_reviews.body: Es un buen equipo, muy potente, 16gb de ram le quedan chicos, para usar todo su potencial necesita los 32gb. El software y los servicios de dell son ideales para tener bien el rendimiento. Si bien es una notebook, su tamaño, peso y cargador(gigante) no la hacen muy comoda para el transporte, y no existe bolsos de notebook para su tamaño por lo que directamente habrá que llevarla en una mochila. 1tb es lo minimo e indispensable para usarla en un principio pero luga ya te deja ver que se necesitará otro ssd. Por mi parte el software de macaffe no es de mi agrado, considero que consume muchos recursos del pc para mantenerlo seguro, y sinceramente si no te metes en paginas raras, no descargas software de dudosa procedencia y no abres los mail spam de "te ganaste un smartphone" con windows defender basta y sobra. Por ultimo note que el software de alienware que trae y el de nvidea se pisan uno al otro buscando optimizar la pc, supongo que bastara con probar cual da mejor resultado y a partir de entonces elegir solo uno de los dos. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Es un buen equipo, muy potente, 16gb de ram le quedan chicos, para usar todo su potencial necesita los 32gb. El software y los servicios de dell son ideales para tener bien el rendimiento. Por ultimo note que el software de alienware que trae y el de nvidea se pisan uno al otro buscando optimizar la pc, supongo que bastara con probar cual da mejor resultado y a partir de entonces elegir solo uno de los dos.

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2025

top_reviews.title: Lesson Learned
top_reviews.body: You see the price and the rating and you think to yourself, wow! That's a great deal for those specs! You see the 4 star rating and accept the risk. And now you're reading the one star reviews like you should have before the purchase.  Absolutely nothing but issues from the moment it was unboxed. The screen won't turn on. The only way to get the computer to boot was performing a hard reset by holding the power button for 35 seconds, and using an external monitor. Computer bluescreens during setup. Flashing error codes 2 yellow, 4 white.  Overheats while idle / sleeping. Completely unusable and a tremendous disappointment. Easily the worst purchase I have ever made in life. Owned for less than 24 hours before requesting a refund. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
You see the price and the rating and you think to yourself, wow! That's a great deal for those specs! You see the 4 star rating and accept the risk. And now you're reading the one star reviews like you should have before the purchase.

The only way to get the computer to boot was performing a hard reset by holding the power button for 35 seconds, and using an external monitor. Computer bluescreens during setup. Flashing error codes 2 yellow, 4 white.

Overheats while idle / sleeping. Completely unusable and a tremendous disappointment. Easily the worst purchase I have ever made in life. Owned for less than 24 hours before requesting a refund.

top_reviews.title: Potent but runs hot
top_reviews.body: Great laptop so far. Upgraded to 64gb ram and installed a WD black 4TB for my primary and using the 1TB for storage. Upgrading was easy, which is nice for a laptop.  I typically run CAD/CAM programs, which this runs with ease. Computing toolpaths is fairly quick for a laptop. OS loads quickly, programs load quickly.  She does get hot though and like others are saying - the power brick weights almost as much as the laptop. So this is more of a desktop alternative than a portable computer.  And do a fresh OS install to clear out all the Dell bloatware and minimize software issues.  Buy it when its on sale - 1800cad was a fair price. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Great laptop so far. Upgraded to 64gb ram and installed a WD black 4TB for my primary and using the 1TB for storage. Upgrading was easy, which is nice for a laptop.

I typically run CAD/CAM programs, which this runs with ease. Computing toolpaths is fairly quick for a laptop. OS loads quickly, programs load quickly.

She does get hot though and like others are saying - the power brick weights almost as much as the laptop. So this is more of a desktop alternative than a portable computer.

And do a fresh OS install to clear out all the Dell bloatware and minimize software issues.

Buy it when its on sale - 1800cad was a fair price.
Read more

top_reviews.title: Great performance NEEDS CLEANING
top_reviews.body: I've been using it for months, It's given me a great deal of performance for the price, running most games at 120 fps comfortably, and hasn't given me any issues in coding. The screen has great colors, it's really smooth. Ram can be an issue, but you can always just slap another stick in there. All these points are great except that IT COLLECTS ALOT of dust, and it warms up a lot and you can see the dust that it accumulated in the vents from the outside. Cleaning can be quite tricky but is doable, considering it must be done often it is annoying. The RGB is mediocre at best, as it doesn't seep through the key caps bright enough, and you don't have many customization options, and the program by alien ware is ok. About the battery, I'd give it 2 stars if this wasn't a gaming laptop, nowadays you can find laptops that last 10 hours, this one can last around 5 if you really push it to save battery, which is good enough for my situation in college. Overall for what it is, and to whom it seems to appeal to it's a decent deal. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
I've been using it for months, It's given me a great deal of performance for the price, running most games at 120 fps comfortably, and hasn't given me any issues in coding. The screen has great colors, it's really smooth. Ram can be an issue, but you can always just slap another stick in there. All these points are great except that IT COLLECTS ALOT of dust, and it warms up a lot and you can see the dust that it accumulated in the vents from the outside. Cleaning can be quite tricky but is doable, considering it must be done often it is annoying. The RGB is mediocre at best, as it doesn't seep through the key caps bright enough, and you don't have many customization options, and the program by alien ware is ok. About the battery, I'd give it 2 stars if this wasn't a gaming laptop, nowadays you can find laptops that last 10 hours, this one can last around 5 if you really push it to save battery, which is good enough for my situation in college. Overall for what it is, and to whom it seems to appeal to it's a decent deal.

top_reviews.title: Garbage, don’t buy it
top_reviews.body: The worst laptop I’ve owned. Returning it.  • Constant blue screens, especially when playing Battlefield 2042. Random restarts mid-game make it impossible to enjoy. • Cheap, low-quality packaging that didn’t feel protective at all. For the price, I expected better. • Bulky power supply in a form of a brick 1/4th the size of the laptop itself. • Crashes, overheating, and restarts ruin the gaming part, definitely not worth the price. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
The worst laptop I’ve owned. Returning it.

• Constant blue screens, especially when playing Battlefield 2042. Random restarts mid-game make it impossible to enjoy.
• Cheap, low-quality packaging that didn’t feel protective at all. For the price, I expected better.
• Bulky power supply in a form of a brick 1/4th the size of the laptop itself.
• Crashes, overheating, and restarts ruin the gaming part, definitely not worth the price.
Read more

top_reviews.title: Works as expected - good value for price
top_reviews.body: Upgraded to 24G RAM (had 16+8 on hand) and works well for playing games on STEAM with Discord in the background and using a USB connected control. Can hear the fans kick in but works wells. The charger is quite bulky so I would not recommend this as a commuting laptop. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Upgraded to 24G RAM (had 16+8 on hand) and works well for playing games on STEAM with Discord in the background and using a USB connected control. Can hear the fans kick in but works wells. The charger is quite bulky so I would not recommend this as a commuting laptop.
Read more
